name: Kaos (KDE on Arch OS)
install_guide_markdown:
# Kaos (KDE on Arch OS) Installation Guide

## About Kaos
- Rolling release Arch-based distribution
- Optimized for KDE Plasma 6
- Pre-integrated KDE ecosystem
- Regular, curated updates

## Prerequisites
- 2GB RAM minimum (4GB recommended for KDE)
- 20GB disk space
- Fast internet connection for packages
- USB drive (3GB+)

## Features
- Latest KDE Plasma always included
- Calamares graphical installer
- Arch User Repository access
- Professional desktop environment

## Step 1: Download ISO
Get KaOS rolling release ISO

## Step 2: Create Bootable USB
Use Etcher or dd

## Step 3: Boot Live System
Experience KDE Plasma 6

## Step 4: Install to Disk
Click installer and follow prompts

## Step 5: Post-Installation
Update system and install additional software

install_steps.title: Download KaOS ISO
install_steps.detail_md: Get the latest KaOS rolling release (2.8GB) with KDE Plasma 6 pre-installed.

install_steps.title: Create Bootable USB
install_steps.detail_md:
Write ISO using Etcher or dd:
```
sudo dd if=KaOS-2024.12.10-x86_64.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M
```

install_steps.title: Boot Live Environment
install_steps.detail_md: Insert USB, restart, select USB in boot menu. Experience full KDE Plasma desktop.

install_steps.title: Launch Calamares Installer
install_steps.detail_md: Click 'Install KaOS' icon on desktop to open graphical installer.

install_steps.title: Set Location & Timezone
install_steps.detail_md: Select your region and timezone for correct system time.

install_steps.title: Configure Keyboard
install_steps.detail_md: Select keyboard layout and test typing to verify correct mapping.

install_steps.title: Configure Partitions
install_steps.detail_md: Choose automatic (simple) or manual (advanced) partitioning. Automatic recommended for new users.

install_steps.title: Create User Account
install_steps.detail_md: Set hostname, username, password, and choose whether to use sudo.

install_steps.title: Install KaOS
install_steps.detail_md: Click Install to write system to disk. May take 10-20 minutes depending on speed.

install_steps.title: Update System
install_steps.detail_md:
After reboot, update all packages:
```
sudo pacman -Syu
```
